intro: Trigonella divaricata, commonly known as the variable trigonella, is a flowering plant species belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow or orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Trigonella divaricata is often found growing along rocky soils and in disturbed areas, showing a degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are small and elliptical, typically containing compounds that may have medicinal or nutritional value.
